reviewText: The late Isabel Sanford and Sherman Hemsley are "movin' on up" again for the sixth hilarious season of the Emmy-winning The Jeffersons. The recently departed Mike Evans returned to the series once again playing Lionel Jefferson,son of George(Hemsley) and Louise "Weezy"(Sanford). ME had left the series in 1975 after the end of the first season to assume duties on his co-creation Good Times(a "niece" or "nephew" of TJ). GT had been cancelled,so ME was able to return to TJ. Damon Evans(no relation to Mike) had resumed the role of Lionel during ME's absence. Before this season began,Sanford guest-starred playing her role on an episode of TJ's parent show All In The Family(during season 9),which got cancelled after 1978-79 like GT. Hemsley guest-starred on an AITF season 8 episode once also. AITF's star character Archie Bunker continued for four more seasons on Archie Bunker's Place. Anyway,here's what happens this season: Lionel and his wife,the former Jenny Willis(Berlinda Tolbert),become parents of Jessica,who is 75% negro and 25% caucasian(on Jenny's father Tom's side). George celebrates his 50th birthday(in real life,Hemsley turned 50 in 1988). Louise and Helen Willis(the late Roxie Roker),who Jenny's mother and Tom's(the late Franklin Cover) wife,are still working at the Help Center and in one episode,Louise brings an adorable little girl named Abby to the Jeffersons' apartment for a few weeks. Abby and George really hit it off great that she learned how to call caucasians "honky"! That's wasn't meant to happen,though. Housebroken Abby had been taken away just after she arrived. The man previously responsible for her was called "honky" by her and he reclaimed her. Tom still is vice-president of Pelham Publishers. George still has his drycleaning business and there's still the Jeffersons' live-in housekeeper Florence Johnston(Marla Gibbs). Still living next door to the Jeffersons and Florence is British-born Harry Bentley(Paul Benedict). The other episodes are great.
summary: Movin' on up for the sixth season!

reviewText: What can you not say about the Jeffersons?  I mean this is good, clean, fun wih your favorite characters of George, Weazy, and Florence. After 30 years it's still great to watch this show and it's still just as funny. This great classic never gets old and I'm enjoying it now just as I did then. I highly recommend it.

reviewText: It's great to see that the sixth season of "The Jeffersons" is now slated for release, just seven months following the DVD set of the fifth season.  This puts the series on DVD past the halfway point now!Despite the fact that this set is bound to be similar to the previous five (with no extras and some video tape picture problems), it is still a worthwhile purchase just to get these classic episodes in their original, uncut CBS broadcast versions.  Each episode that I can view in this fashion, as opposed to the butchered reruns shown on TV Land, is a great thing in my opinion!Supporting this box set should only serve to give Sony Pictures Home Entertainment more faith to continue releasing this series on DVD.  If you enjoy this show at all, please shell out the few dollars it will take to own this one.  Let's see if we can't get all eleven seasons released!
summary: We're Past the Halfway Point Now!

reviewText: "The Jeffersons - The Complete Sixth Season" continues with George & Louise living the glamorous life in their Manhattan apartment hi-rise complex. There are two notable cast changes this season - gone is Jay Hammer, who portrayed Allan Willis in Season Five. Mike Evans returns to the cast after a four season absence, with the role of Lionel previously played by Damon Evans (no relation), a role Damon fulfilled for three seasons. Mike had originally played the role of Lionel during the first season, but left soon afterward to co-produce a sitcom he helped create - "Good Times". When "GT" ended its six-season run in 1979, Mike Evans returned to the cast of "TJ". Lionel #1 would return just in time for he & Jenny to witness the birth of their daughter Jessica - with George, Louise, Tom & Helen all becoming grandparents for the first time in the episode titled "The Expectant Father". Louise is a material witness of a murder in the episode "Now You See It, Now You Don't", where she is talen hostage by the criminal, who's wearing a rabbit suit. Tom tries hard to impress Helen's friends in the hilarious episode "Brother Tom". George clashes with a hot-headed individual who challenges George to a boxing match in "Joltin' George" - a very funny episode! George winds up in a mental hospital in "One Flew Into The Cuckoo's Nest", while Louise & Florence duke it out in "Louise vs. Florence". There are still a plethora of great, funny episodes to choose from here. Pick up Season Six today! The only other question that needs to be answered is: "When will the final five seasons of 'The Jeffersons' be released?". It's been seven years since Season Six was released! Hopefully Shout! Factory will release seasons 7 through 11 very soon.R.I.P., Sherman Hemsley, Isabel Sanford, Roxie Roker, Franklin Cover, Paul Benedict, Mike Evans, Vernon Washington & Ned Wertimer.
summary: George & Louise are "Movin' On Up" in Season 6!

reviewText: One of the most successful TV Series in all the world. A spin-off from the one that started many other TV Series spin-offs... The One-the Only- All In The Family. The Jeffersons we're the pickering argumentive neighbors of Edith and Archie Bunker of the same TV show-All In The Family. The characters proved popular that series creator-Developer Norman Lear decided that this would make a great solo TV Series. This primise was titled. THE JEFFERSONS. Starring the legendary late-great Isabel Sanford and also the legendary co-lead star Sherman Hemsley. Playing Lousie Jefferson populary know as "Wezzy" was at first a roll that Isabel Sanford did not want to materialize for her own solo TV Series. She felt that playing the same character on  All In The Family would be alot easier and more recgonizable, and the fact Sanford did not want to be the star of her own show. But the producers of All In The Family said,you have a chance doing your own show and if you want to put food on the table and survive we highly suggest you do. well, she made Television history by doing just that. And Sherman Hemsley as the loud-mouth master of the secrets to getting your dry cleaning buisness... George Jefferson. I really don't know how Sherman Hemsley felt about doing The Jeffersons at that point in 1975 when both lead-stars of the show was approched with the idea. But hey, Hemsley also made the smart move of doing the show, and The Jeffersons: The Complete Sixth Season will be released on March 27th 2007. completely excellent. so don't be no jive turkey... I will be ordering soon.
summary: Something funky and more delicious is coming back to Manhatton on the east side hi-rise of New York

reviewText: Wow! I feel like a little kid at Xmas time, with the long awaited release of Maude on March 20th, a six season release of All in the Family Feb. 13th, and another installment of The Jeffersons!!! Thank you Sony!!! Eventhough I'm thankful to see The Jeffersons being released, it would be nice if there was some kind of tribute or rememberance of cast members who are no longer with us, which include Roxie Roker, Franklin Cover, Isabel Sanford, and Mike Evans. I was looking at an episode of All in the Family today on dvd (The one when George and Louise move on up), and it was kind of sad to realize that more than half of the original cast of the Jeffersons is gone, along with Mother Jefferson.Unfortunately, most shows from the 70's don't get the royal treatment with dvd extras like current tv shows. It just seems like the studios just don't care enough to take the time to include the actors, who are a major part of the shows success. I'm sure Sherman Hemsley, Marla Gibbs, Paul Benedict, and Belinda Tolbert would love to share their stories of being apart of a sitcom classic!!! Oh well, I guess I'll just be grateful to even get The Jeffersons and All in the Family on dvd!
summary: I'M GOING TO BE LIKE A KID IN A CANDY STORE ON MARCH 27th!!!!!
